body: @ser72 there should be entries in the logs in this case - can you double check? thx
after a fresh install of oc, a re-configuration with identical configuration, the smb shows up as a folder???

> {"app":"core","message":"storage backend \oc\files\storage\smb not found","level":3,"time":"2013-09-27t15:48:14+00:00"}

this indicates that the external files backend got deactivated

> {"app":"php","message":"session setup failed: nt_status_logon_failure params(-d 0 '\/\/192.168.1.58\/matt' -c 'dir \"\*\"') at \/var\/www\/owncloud512rc1\/3rdparty\/smb4php\/smb.php#187","level":2,"time":"2013-09-27t15:47:24+00:00"}

this shows user and pass are wrong?

interesting since the same mount was made to another oc instance at that time -- which to me says the files on the back end are there.?

the password was verified (with the eyeball) and typed several times.  the same password was used in all instances.
as you can see from the screen shots, the user id is the same in both the working and non-working instances.

the interesting thing is that i was unable to reproduce after a fresh install of oc.  i even was successful in doing a personal mount.  a little bothersome and difficult to troubleshoot if you ask me
